reviews.title: Bizarre place
reviews.text: Arrived at Windy Ridge in the picturesque fields of whitstable. Away from the hustle and bustle of the village but still in walking distance which was ideal.

We arrived in Whitstable on a sunny Saturday afternoon without a booking and struggled find somewhere to stay. We eventually "settled" as a last resort on Windy Ridge thinking it was a bit of a mission as it was a 5 minute drive from the city centre. It was the best thing we could have done. Jean and her partner are charming hosts, and really lovely people. We were made to feel like old friends, and we only stayed a night!
reviews.title: Absolute gem of a find

We spent the late afternoon walking through the local nature reserve and winding lanes whilst watching the sun set.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this lovely B&B with my husband. We were not disappointed at all, in fact, we loved the tranquility of it. The owners, being in their 70s are still full of beans and are very friendly. Breakfast was fresh and tasty. The house has a very old, homey feel to it, but also has a newly built extention right next to the main house. We stayed in a very bright room. Anything extra you require, can be asked for with no problem. Tiny shower cubicle and a slighly softer bed than what we are used to, but these are just minor things; if you are staying for 2-3 nights it is perfect. We were a bit unlucky with the neighbours downstairs, as the walls are not soundproof and you can hear everything, but cannot blame the owners for that of course! Staying in town would have been a lot more noisier! A lot of hard work has gone into keeping up this b&b, huge garden and it also has a license to hold weddings, as we have discovered looking at some of the few certificates on the wall of the reception area. Thank you Jean and John! It was very nice meeting you and we will surely choose your place next time we are in Whitstable and recommend to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Tucked away from a busy whitstable, lovely simply lovely
A real "get away from it all"
reviews.text: John and Jean are perfect, gentle and friendly hosts. We had a delightful room overlooking the fields with the sea in the distance, and all the little additional niceities one would expect. Everything is spotless. The breakfast is very traditional and we just had to indulge in the fresh fruit and "full English". Service is unobtrusive and a request for an extra towel at 11:15 at night was met with a cheery "give me two minutes". Windy Ridge represents very good value for money. The taxi service into town is excellent, but for those wishing to potter around the area, a car is a 'must'. We will return! A&C

reviews.title: Prepare to be spoilt at Whitstable's best kept secret - a tranquil hideaway with stunning views.
reviews.text: We enjoyed the comfort of a spacious and beautiful room, the Majestic, with views over Whitstable and the Isle of Sheppey. Whitstable is a two mile walk/drive and we loved escaping from the bustling town back to our peaceful hideaway. Our hosts made us feel so welcome with a great range of breakfast eats and some jolly chit chat. The weekend offered great value for money and an intriguing alternative to more pricey accommodation in the town centre.

reviews.title: great
reviews.text: Lovely kind owners, great breakfast. Very nice old building with views over the country and sea.

reviews.title: LOVING IT ALL
reviews.text: just back from a night at windy ridge, we had a lovely time, the whole place was lovely and our room was really nice. we stayed in smugglers room, it was beautifully furnished, very good size amd beds were very comfortable. the owners are really nice and extremely helpful. The breakfast is yummy! The views are lovely and whitstable has quaint interesting shops with many restaurants and cafes. WILL BE VISITING AGAIN.

reviews.title: A hidden gem!
reviews.text: I chose this B & B for its location and it lived up to my expectation. Lovely views, peaceful and tranquil. I received a very warm welcome, nothing was too much trouble for this lovely couple. Loved my room on the ground floor with its french window out onto the garden. Extremely comfortable (better than my own room), great shower (sometimes they can be hit and miss). All toiletries supplied and as much tea and coffee was you would wish also provided. Breakfast huge and filling, again nothing was too much trouble. As I was a little under the weather and wanted a peaceful few days away I was looked after and made to feel like one of the family.

description: Windy Ridge is a uniquely built property surrounded by beautiful private gardens on a hill overlooking Whitstable and the coastline, with Canterbury only 15mins away by car. The panoramic views of the sea and the sunsets that Whitstable is famous for are stunning. Serving fabulous freshly cooked to order breakfasts in the dining room, where home-made and local produce is used. Ample parking and licensed premises. Arrive as a guest but leave as a friend.
